title: Open-Set Source Tracing of Audio Deepfake Systems
author: Nicholas Klein (Pindrop), Hemlata Tak (Pindrop), Elie Khoury (Pindrop), ...
relevance_why: This paper presents advanced methodologies for open-set source tracing of audio deepfakes, which can contribute to Haohe Liu's research on audio quality enhancement and restoration through potential applications in detecting synthesis artifacts.
background: Detecting the source or origin of manipulated audio in scenarios where not all systems have been trained on can critically improve forensic analysis, IP protection, and trust in audio technologies.
contribution: This paper introduces a new adaptation to energy-based detection scores for out-of-distribution detection, termed softmax energy (SME), to enhance open-set source tracing performance in audio deepfakes, achieving a false positive rate of 8.3%.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods in source tracing mainly considered closed-set scenarios and had limited efficacy in open-set contexts.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves open-set performance by utilizing SME, achieving a 31% better average false positive rate compared to traditional energy scores.

key_innovation: The introduction of softmax energy effectively highlights the difference between in-distribution (ID) and out-of-distribution (OOD) samples by enhancing score discrimination.
real_world_impact: By accurately tracing the sources of audio deepfakes, this research has significant implications for improving verification systems in communication and media, potentially increasing trust and accountability in audio technologies.
limitations: The study may require further evaluations to address challenges in distinguishing OOD systems closely related to ID systems in training.

new_terms.open-set source tracing: **Open-set source tracing** refers to the ability to identify the source of manipulated audio when some source systems are not included in the training data, challenging traditional identification methods.
new_terms.softmax energy (SME): **Softmax energy (SME)** is a novel metric that improves out-of-distribution sample detection by utilizing softmax outputs to better distinguish between in-domain and out-of-domain audio samples.
